channel.title: Server Choices
channel.description:
Hey guys i'm not coding still but just wanted to have a discussion on servers here, please add to the conversation.
So my first point to address is what the fuck is up with PI's? Why would somebody want to start a PI, it's not oldschool nor a new server type. I think it's right in the middle which blows. I mean I personally choose either like 728's or something like Delta oldschool Rune-legacy type.
My second point to address is why the hell are we posting guides over and over again. I left about 2 months ago when I quit and now that I come back and look at the guides and snippets section it's the same shit.
My third point to address is why the hell did we get rid of reputation. I think that we need reputation even if we revise it completely we need a god damn rep system! How are we supposed to know who is a complete fucking noob posting some shitty leech and who is posting a revolutionary server? Plus when a noob posts something good I want to rep them up because I want them to help be recognized by our community.
My final point to address is server quantities. To noobs: Stop making servers if you're complete shit, don't download a server and host it, you need to code something first. You will never succeed if you don't. Also I think we need to stop making so many damn servers, With so many with about 10 players on them it's way to hard to get players and recruit people. I think we need to cut down on server quantities because the players are way to spread out it's impossible to make a new successful server, it's the same 10 from 2 years ago that have the most players.
Feel free to respond to this add what point you are responding to so it can help us.

item.title: Server Choices
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:19, topic:462206”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=565161.msg4114107#msg4114107 date=1348859548]
There aren’t enough tutorials for sources like Apollo which is why people turn to PI, they can add whatever they want with a tutorial and without having knowledge in java.
[/quote]

Except, when you make tutorials for them the tutorials get pushed to the bottom of the list.[/quote]
and never get found again…

Read full topic

item.title: Server Choices
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:14, topic:462206”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=565161.msg4112843#msg4112843 date=1348704395]

  1. Opinion and Preference, if people like 317 load 700+ then let them like it, you’re in no position to tell them what they can and can’t like/make
  2. If you want some original content then write some and post it yourself, people work at their own pace and only share what they feel is necessary
  3. Because the new members were getting spammed with – because of one stupid or ignorant post they may have made, regardless of their other posts.
  4. Don’t discourage the new coders considering when you first joined here you grave dug and leeched like mad from what I can recall. We need new members to continue developing servers after we’ve gotten sick of them, otherwise RSPS will basically die out.
    [/quote]

RSPS died out when people realised you could make money out of it. We have been beating a dead horse for years.

The same tutorials are released daily, the same servers with the same changes are released daily. Everytime someone contributes something remotely against the grain it gets drowned by 100 copies of the same shit.[/quote]
I’ll believe you when this community and any others that are rsps related drain to 50 active members. What’s dead in your eyes aren’t everyone else’s views on the subject, I personally still enjoy seeing things released and playing on servers. Sure, it’s nice to see something different, probably better actually, but I’m not going to go and take away basically every right that new people have on this website, it turns people away from the community.

In reality, we won’t always be working with this so some kind of fan base has to be here to continue working on it, otherwise the community will die because we’re only supporting what we find fun and our word is law, despite us being no better than them (besides our ability to properly speak English, maybe :rolleyes:)

Read full topic

item.title: Server Choices
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

I remember when you were new.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Ring a bell?

I also remember when I was new. I was so proud of having an allstar I went mad and started going around saying I canz code. Oh course, my story is different since I was 8/9

Read full topic

2. If you want some original content then write some and post it yourself, people work at their own pace and only share what they feel is necessary
3. Because the new members were getting spammed with – because of one stupid or ignorant post they may have made, regardless of their other posts.
4. Don’t discourage the new coders considering when you first joined here you grave dug and leeched like mad from what I can recall. We need new members to continue developing servers after we’ve gotten sick of them, otherwise RSPS will basically die out.[/quote]

RSPS died out when people realised you could make money out of it. We have been beating a dead horse for years.

The same tutorials are released daily, the same servers with the same changes are released daily. Everytime someone contributes something remotely against the grain it gets drowned by 100 copies of the same shit.

item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“devenb123, post:1, topic:462206”]Hey guys i’m not coding still but just wanted to have a discussion on servers here, please add to the conversation.

So my first point to address is what the fuck is up with PI’s? Why would somebody want to start a PI, it’s not oldschool nor a new server type. I think it’s right in the middle which blows. I mean I personally choose either like 728’s or something like Delta oldschool Rune-legacy type.

My second point to address is why the hell are we posting guides over and over again. I left about 2 months ago when I quit and now that I come back and look at the guides and snippets section it’s the same shit.

My third point to address is why the hell did we get rid of reputation. I think that we need reputation even if we revise it completely we need a god damn rep system! How are we supposed to know who is a complete fucking noob posting some shitty leech and who is posting a revolutionary server? Plus when a noob posts something good I want to rep them up because I want them to help be recognized by our community.

My final point to address is server quantities. To noobs: Stop making servers if you’re complete shit, don’t download a server and host it, you need to code something first. You will never succeed if you don’t. Also I think we need to stop making so many damn servers, With so many with about 10 players on them it’s way to hard to get players and recruit people. I think we need to cut down on server quantities because the players are way to spread out it’s impossible to make a new successful server, it’s the same 10 from 2 years ago that have the most players.

Feel free to respond to this add what point you are responding to so it can help us.[/quote]

  1. Opinion and Preference, if people like 317 load 700+ then let them like it, you’re in no position to tell them what they can and can’t like/make
  2. If you want some original content then write some and post it yourself, people work at their own pace and only share what they feel is necessary
  3. Because the new members were getting spammed with – because of one stupid or ignorant post they may have made, regardless of their other posts.
  4. Don’t discourage the new coders considering when you first joined here you grave dug and leeched like mad from what I can recall. We need new members to continue developing servers after we’ve gotten sick of them, otherwise RSPS will basically die out.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Choices
item.dc:creator: @TimeRS3 TimeRS3
item.description:
@TimeRS3 wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:8, topic:462206”]1: most of these points have topics already.
2: the rest has nothing to do with rsps discussion.
3: Why can’t noobs make servers? Everyone has to start somewhere and editing a server is starting them off understanding how java is case sensitive. I remember when you first started, you needed alot of help and the moparians helped us, now you need to understand that people need to learn too. Rep isn’t gone for good btw, only until we find a better system.[/quote]

rep will be back soon as taharok said in the announcements and everyone here has a right to make a server doesn’t really matter if it is leeched i started out as a leech i used the matrix scratch files which eventually turned out into the NRS3server we all know today who knows what looks like the crappiest server in history may turn out as the greatest rsps known to all programmers

Moparian means nothing to me its just a member group assigned once you reach a number of posts all moparians you see have over 1000 posts

Read full topic
